title: Getting Started with React: A Beginners Guide
content: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It was developed by Facebook and has become one of the most popular front-end libraries in the world.

React makes it painless to create interactive UIs. Design simple views for each state in your application, and React will efficiently update and render just the right components when your data changes.
To start with React, you'll need to have Node.js installed on your computer. Once you have Node.js, you can create a new React project using Create React App:

npx create-react-app my-app
cd my-app
npm start
Components are the building blocks of any React application. A component is a self-contained module that renders some output.
React is a powerful library that can help you build better web applications.

title: Advanced JavaScript Concepts You Should Know
content: Closures are functions that have access to their outer scope, even after the outer function has finished executing.
JavaScript has function scope and block scope. Closures leverage lexical scoping.

function outer() {
  let count = 0;
  return function inner() {
    count++;
    console.log(count);
  };
}
const counter = outer();
counter(); // 1
counter(); // 2
